VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows: Special
investigation 2024SIC0001334 dated 4/19/24 with two violations being found.
The violation were for rules 400.4127 and 722.120. This CAP involved action
steps including staff retraining on supervision/bed checks, Chief Administrator
conducting ramdom camera checks once per week, disciplinary action for staff if
found in non-compliance, reminders to staff to follow the policy for
supervision/bed checks, employees found falsifying bed checks during this
review of the camera footage will receive discipline action, and the code of
ethics will be reviewed by all staff. During the quarterly unannounced visits, the
facility was found to be in compiance with efforts to complete the action steps.
They provided written documentation of the actions taken.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment addresses the special investigation
2024SIC0001334 dated 4/19/24 with two violations for rules 400.4127 and
722.120. This report addresses that the facility is following the action steps and
finding this to be very helpful in the development of the program offered.
Additional training is providing positive outcomes with staff and their interactions
with youth. Administration continues to monitor overnight staff to ensure
compliance with room checks and documentation. It is documented that there
were two unplanned discharges during this reporting period involving the
passing away of one youth and the replacement of another youth because of
increased safety concerns. The facility is documented as increasing their
networking to ensure the level of mental health services needed by youth is
being provided.

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed all reported strong support from administration and receiving
appropriate training to help them provide a healthy, nurturing, and therapeutic
setting for the youth in care. Staff presented with a strong connection to the
youth in care and believe they can help make a difference in the youth’s life.
All three youth in care were interviewed and none reported having issues at the
facility. They also reported feeling safe and that the program was very helpful
for their healing and growth. They believe staff are providing supervision and
are very helpful when they are having struggles.
Description of Agency Walk Through
This is an older three-story older building which the youth have access to the
first two stories. The facility is appropriately maintained and clean. There were
no compliance issues found and the furnishing were all appropriate. Medication
was locked as required and all plumbing was in working order. There was ample
food for the youth and the menu was posted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
